title: Ei Raja (tube Skirt), 1900–69
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: tied resist patterning in warp (ikat) on plain weave
description: Rectangular panel made up of two lengths of cloth stitched together, each showing a series of geometric patterned stripes. The stripes are in groups or isolated by solid dark blue stripes. The seven narrow dark blue stripes on each skirt half are associated with the Greater Blossom or 'hubi ae' ancestral group. Colors: dark blue, rust-red, ivory.

tombstone.epitaph:
Ei Raja (tube Skirt), 1900–69.Medium: cotton
